products.title: SLUB YARN
products.description:
Slub yarn is persistently spun with slubs (thicker sections along the yarn). It is now purposefully designed to add personality to fabric. Alternatively, a slub can be three or four times the thickness of the base yarn, with the thickness increase occurring over a short length of thread. Slubs can also be made by altering the card settings so that the fiber material is 'rolled' into slubs. This is essentially the inverse of the standard carding motion. They are used in readymade garment, high-end shirting materials and many more.

APPLICATIONS AND USAGES

  • Time saving and more productive
  • Resistant in shrinking and durable in nature
  • Three or four times thicker than the base yarn
  • Shooter length comparatively to the others
  • Used in Sweating and knitting warm clothes
  • Designed to add quality in fabrics
  • Major yarns that help in making laces
  • Upholstery and Curtains
  • Handicrafts and furnishing cloths
  • Have revolutionized the denim and shirting market

As wool fibers are packed together, tiny air pockets allow the material to absorb and release moisture. This can help absorb perspiration odors that are only released upon washing. Wool fibers are coiled, so they revert to their natural shape after being bent, preventing creases and wrinkles. Wool's moisture and temperature control capabilities to benefit people with chronic skin issues.

products.title: KAPOK
products.description:
Kapok fiber is a natural cellulosic fiber made from kapok seed hairs. It has a peculiar structure with 80–90% empty microtubes. Kapok fiber stuffs cushions, bedding, and some other soft toys. It's used as life preservers as well as sound and heat insulation due to its buoyancy and air-filled lumen. Its waxy surface gives it good hydrophobic–oleophilic properties, hence it's become popular as an oil-absorbing substance. Natural microtubes can be employed as a template material or catalyst carrier.

APPLICATIONS AND USAGES

  • Absorbent material for oils, metal ions, dyes and sound
  • Used as a second-generation source for bioethanol
  • As a filter product for deep-bed filtration to achieve oil/water separation
  • As stuffing for bedding, upholstery, and life preservers
  • Microbiological Property
  • Activated carbon fibers
  • biofuel
  • Yachts and boat furnishing
  • Substitute of cotton in surgery
  • Lightweight and comfortable

products.title: VISCOSE FIBER
products.description:
Viscose was first made in 1883 to replace natural silk. This fabric is made from treated wood pulp woven into threads. Soft, lightweight viscose drapes beautifully and is used in clothing, upholstery, and bedding. Moreover, this flexible fabric is never forgotten to be used in jacket linings, t-shirts, sportswear, dresses, and tunics. It is also combined with cotton and polyester to improve their benefits, demonstrating its versatility and flexibility. Wood cellulose is processed through several steps to make the viscose fabric.

  • Used as Embroidery thread, chenille, novelty yarns

products.title: BAMBOO FIBER
products.description:
Bamboo is a biodegradable, natural, cellulosic fiber. Green fiber with anti-bacterial and UV protection properties makes it a unique and ecofriendly textile material in the modern 21st century. Alkaline hydrolysis, multi-phase bleaching, and chemical treatment of starchy pulp yield bamboo fiber. Bamboo's micro-gaps make it softer and more moisture-absorbing than cotton. Biodegradable, eco-friendly, stretchy. The fiber is bacteriostatic, antifungal, antibacterial, hypoallergenic, hydroscopic, and UV-resistant. It's also durable, stable, tough, and tensile. Bamboo fibers are also used to make clothes, towels, bathrobes, and decorations due to their versatility.

APPLICATIONS AND USAGES

  • Breathable Clothing
  • Good for hot weather
  • Powerful insulating
  • Moisture Wicking

products.title: ACRYLIC FIBER
products.description:
Acrylic fiber is usually manufactured at facilities that also make other synthetic textiles. Acrylic fabric is one of the least permeable textiles in the world, hence it's used in heat-retention applications. Acrylic fabric is often used in athletic apparel, such as tracksuits, hoodies, and athletic pants. It may be carcinogenic, so it's best to avoid touching it with your skin. This kind of fiber may contain lower amounts of other synthetic compounds, but it must have at least 85% acrylonitrile to be deemed legitimate. Depending on the compounds combined with acrylonitrile, the resultant cloth will have varying properties.

 

APPLICATIONS AND USAGES

  • Strong Resistance to Sunlight
  • Resistance to Chemical agents
  • Lighter and stronger than glass

  • Easy to clean, maintain and shape

products.description:
It is a primary type of polyester yarn produced directly from PTA and MEG or by spinning Polyester PET Chips. PARTIALLY ORIENTED YARN (POY) is comprised of incompletely stretched filaments with an orientation degree between un-oriented filaments and pulled filaments that are produced by high-speed spinning. In comparison to undrawn yarn, it has a considerable degree of direction and excellent stability, but it cannot be employed in textile processing. It is typically used to create textured yarn that can be utilized in warping for weaving and warp knitting of fabrics.

APPLICATIONS AND USAGES

  • Shrinkage range above 80%
  • Focuses on texturizing process
  • Applicable in ladies dress materials, shirts, suits, sarees, knitwear
  • Sportswear
  • Home textile, automotive materials
  • Has around 2 to 5% crystallinity
  • Stable structure for short duration (6 to 8 months)
  • Used to make textured yarn for warp knitting of fabrics
  • Does not fade on the exposure to sunlight or soap
  • More Durable and wrinkle resistant

products.title: Polyester Drawn Textured Yarn (DTY)
products.description:
Drawn Textured Yarn (DTY) is made by twisting and drawing Polyester POY. DTY yarn is used for weaving and knitting clothes, home decorations, seat covers, purses, and other items. Different heating procedures can be used to set yarn for specialized uses. DTY yarn can be created using different combinations of Intermingle points. These Intermingle yarns, also known as Interlaced yarn, replace moderately twisted yarns. Such twisted yarn can also be heat-set to permanently thermo-set the twist. Cationic DTY is another kind of Polyester DTY used for blankets.

APPLICATIONS AND USAGES

products.title: BCF YARN
products.description:
BCF yarn refers to a one-step method in which multiple filament yarns are tangled up by airflow. A type of filamentous yarn whose raw material is polypropylene and whose filaments are extremely bulky. These yarns are fluffy, but not springy. Extremely thicky, they serve as a replacement for acrylic and wool yarns in the production of machine-woven carpets, carpet covers, etc. Additionally, these yarns are utilized for various threads that call for yarns with a high-volumetric and coating coefficient.

products.title: CORE SPUN YARN
products.description:
Many spinning techniques effectively make core-spun yarns. Core-spun yarn is used to enhance fabric strength, durability, and stretch comfort. During the process of tailoring, the sewing thread is stressed and strained at several places. The needle is accelerated to nearly 180 km/h in the forward direction, brought to rest, and then accelerated backwards before coming to rest. Hence, the Core-spun sewing threads can meet the high speed. Development of core-spun yarn with ring spinning system opens road for new goods like high-performance fabrics, sewing threads, and garmenting.

APPLICATIONS AND USAGES

  • Extremely strong
  • Thicker and resilient
  • High level of tenacity
  • Superior abrasion
  • Better ply security
  • Used in leather products, mattresses, and quilts
  • Less unravel-type thread breaks
  • Its traditional ring spinning, easiest and economic systems
  • It’s 40% to 50% tougher than regular spun yarn of the same weight
  • Improve the fabric’s breathability and durability

products.title: SIRO YARN
products.description:
Siro Yarn is manufactured by Siro or Eli twist spinning. This is done on a ring spinning machine. Siro yarns are carded, combed, carded compact and combed compact. Cost reductions at the fabric stage are transmitted to pure wool garment makers. The SIRO yarns feature higher tenacity, elongation, and reduced hairiness. SIRO Yarn is well-suited for lightweight trans-seasonal textiles; hence many worsted spinning installations have been converted to this cost-saving CSIRO technology.

APPLICATIONS AND USAGES

  • Low hairiness
  • High CLSP
  • Low thin, thick and slubs
  • Advantageous to fabric producers
  • Exclusively used in the production of weaving yarns
  • High yarn strength and better evenness
  • Knitting before dying

  • Excludes separate twisting process

products.title: WATERPROOF FABRIC
products.description:
Polyurethane, polyvinyl chloride, silicone, and wax are all common waterproofing materials. In most circumstances, waterproof fabric is tested in a laboratory and must meet industry standards. Woven fabrics with a waterproof covering include millions of tiny pores that are about 1/20th the size of a rain drop yet considerably larger than a water vapor molecule. These pores let body heat and moisture escape while keeping liquid water out, such as rain. Breathability can also be measured in grams of water vapor per square meter per day. Waterproof clothes of higher quality also include a "durable water repellent."

APPLICATIONS AND USAGE of Waterproof Fabric 

  • Such garments are waterproof, but they do not allow the skin to breathe.
  • Remedied by incorporating vents or armpit zippers into the design of the garment.
  • Preserve the moisture-wicking capabilities
  • Once damaged, the waterproof membrane of a fabric cannot be repaired.
  • Higher-quality waterproof garments also have a "durable water repellent" (DWR)
  • Stylish new beanbag for your home
  • Four-way stretch feature that is said to be more comfortable

products.title: BI-COMPONENT STRETCH FABRIC
products.description:
Bicomponent fiber is composed of two components that each have desirable qualities. Extrusion spinning can be used to make such fibers. One or both elements may be present in the final product, or one substance may be dissolved, leaving only one material. DuPont, for example, developed Cantrese – a highly coiled elastic fiber with two distinct nylon polymers side by side. Because fibrils of one polymer are scattered in the matrix of another polymer, islands-in-the-sea extrusions are also known as matrix-fibril extrusions. The matrix is referred to as the "sea," and the fibrils are referred to as islands. Melt blown islands in the sea can be used to make cloth such as Alcantara.

APPLICATIONS AND USAGES

  • Melt blown islands in the sea can be used to make cloth such as Alcantara.
  • Thermal fusion
  • Self-bulking
  • Extremely fine fibers
  • distinct cross sections
  • Uniformity of the adhesive
  • Fiber maintains the integrity of the building.
  • Tailored sheath materials to affix different materials
  • Various bonding temperatures
  • Cleaner, more ecologically conscious (no effluent)
  • Lamination, molding, densification, and recycling of composites

products.description:
A chemical procedure is used to create the synthetic material known as microfiber. It is made of substances like wood pulp, nylon polymers, and polyester. Materials created with microfiber are less likely to shrink and wrinkle than those made with natural fibers, but they still retain a soft and durable feel. Microfiber was initially created as a mass-produced, low-cost substitute for natural fibers. Despite being developed as a less expensive substitute for natural fibers, microfiber has become a highly sought-after fabric because of its supple, sleek feel, water and stain resistant capabilities, and affordability.

products.description:

Spandex can stretch up to five times its original length and return to its initial shape without losing its integrity. This fabric is commonly blended with fibers like cotton, polyester, or nylon to enhance the final product's flexibility, comfort, and durability. Spandex's ability to provide a comfortable, supportive fit while allowing freedom of movement makes it indispensable in creating a wide range of garments and applications.

Spandex fabric is about flexibility, comfort, durability, and easy care. It resists perspiration, lotions, and detergents, making it ideal for active and everyday wear. Its lightweight and smooth texture also ensures a sleek look and feel, making it a favourite in fashion and functional clothing.

products.title: Rayon Fabric
products.description:
Rayon fabric, also known as viscose, is a versatile semi-synthetic textile derived from natural cellulose fibers, naturally sourced from wood pulp or bamboo. This process involves dissolving cellulose into a solution and then regenerating it into fibers. The result is a silky texture fabric, outstanding breathability, and a luxurious drape, making it a popular choice in different applications. Rayon is known for mimicking the feel and texture of natural fibers like silk, wool, cotton, and linen. It is available in various finishes, including matte, shiny, and textured, offering a wide range of aesthetic possibilities. Also, rayon can be dyed in vibrant colors, adding versatility and appeal.

products.title: Corduroy Fabric
products.description:
Corduroy fabric is a famous textile made from cotton or a cotton-blend, recognized for its unique vertical ribs, called "cords" or "wales," which give it a textured and plush feel. The fabric undergoes a special weaving process to create these raised ridges, providing a tactile and visual appeal that sets it apart from other materials. Known for its durability, warmth, and comfort, corduroy is versatile and suitable for different garments and home furnishings. Its ability to retain heat makes it a favorite for cold-weather clothing, while its distinctive appearance adds style to any piece.

products.title: MEG
products.description:
MEG, also known as mono-ethylene glycol, is a critical component used in the manufacture of polyester fibers and films, PET resins, and engine coolants. MEG has a wide range of final products, including garments and other fabrics, packaging, kitchenware, engine coolants, and antifreeze. It is miscible with various chemical compounds, alcohols, and water. In the UK, Europe, and all around the world, Solventis is a top provider of mono ethylene glycol in bulk and a distributor of MEG.

USES AND APPLICATIONS

  • An important raw material for industrial applications
  • Utilized in the manufacture of polyester (pet) resins
  • Utilized as raw material for paper industry, polyester resins, adhesives and inks
  • Used as a dehydration agent in natural gas pipelines
  • A minor ingredient in a variety of cleaners
  • Used to form a film in paints, enamels, and varnishes
  • MEG ingestion impacts the central nervous system, heart and can cause acute kidney failure

products.title: DEG
products.description:
It has a boiling point of 245 °C, is a water-soluble liquid, and is soluble in a variety of organic solvents. MEG (mono ethylene glycol) and DEG (diethylene glycol) have qualities that are similar, however DEG has a greater boiling point, viscosity, and specific gravity. Polyester fiber, PET resins, alkyds, and unsaturated polyesters are all made using MEG as a basic ingredient. Plasticizers, polyurethanes, and unsaturated polyester resins are all produced using diethylene glycol. Ethylene oxide is partially hydrolyzed to create DEG. Different levels of DEG and related glycols are created based on the circumstances. Two molecules of ethylene glycol linked together by an ether bond make up the final product.

USES AND APPLICATIONS

  • TCC’s diethylene glycol is used as a dehydrating agent for natural gas
  • A raw material for the production of plasticizers and polyester resins
  • A humectant
  • A textile lubricant and coupling agent
  • A solvent in textile dyeing and printing
  • A constituent of hydraulic fluids
  • A plasticizer for paper, cork and synthetic sponges
  • A solvent in printing inks
  • A raw material for the production of esters used as emulsifiers, demulsifiers, lubricants
  • A selective solvent for aromatics in petroleum refining

products.title: TEG
products.description:
It has a boiling point of 245 °C, is a water-soluble liquid, and is soluble in a variety of organic solvents. MEG (mono ethylene glycol) and DEG (diethylene glycol) have qualities that are similar, however DEG has a greater boiling point, viscosity, and specific gravity. Polyester fiber, PET resins, alkyds, and unsaturated polyesters are all made using MEG as a basic ingredient. Plasticizers, polyurethanes, and unsaturated polyester resins are all produced using diethylene glycol. Ethylene oxide is partially hydrolyzed to create DEG. Different levels of DEG and related glycols are created based on the circumstances. Two molecules of ethylene glycol linked together by an ether bond make up the final product.

USES AND APPLICATIONS

  • Hygroscopic quality can absorb moisture from the air through absorption or adsorption
  • A transparent, colorless, low volatility, moderate-viscosity, water-soluble liquid
  • Used preferentially in applications requiring a higher boiling point than diethylene glycol
  • Used preferentially in higher molecular weight than diethylene glycol
  • Used preferentially in lower volatility than diethylene glycol
  • Industrial uses include adsorbents and functional fluids in both closed and open systems

products.title: HDPE
products.description:
HDPE is produced utilizing activated chromium oxide, Ziegler-Natta, and metallocene catalysts at low temperatures and pressures (known as a Phillips catalyst). The most popular name and abbreviation for high density polyethylene plastic is HDPE sheet plastic. The Type 2 plastic HDPE is frequently used to create bottles for detergents, bleaches, shampoos, conditioners, milk, motor oil, and soap. Heat resistance and the density-to-strength profile of HDPE are key metrics. Since HDPE can be molded and worked with ease at temperatures up to its maximum service temperature, it is renowned for its heat resilience.

USES AND APPLICATIONS

  • Heat resistance
  • Density-to-strength profile
  • Remains serviceable and rigid up until its max serviceable temperatures
  • Efficiently molded and worked
  • Melting point can also be quite high
  • HDPE sheet is often used for outdoor applications as it can stand some of the most extreme weather
  • Because HDPE has such high impact, chemical, and weather resistance, HDPE can outlast traditional materials
  • HDPE sheeting is recyclable, which is why many recycled plastic products
  • Used in fuel tanks, telecom ducts, piping systems

products.title: LDPE
products.description:
Low-density Polyethelene (LDPE) is one among the more affordable polymers that are accessible. Due to its flexibility, barrier qualities, superior impact strength, and stress crack resistance, low-density polyethelene (LDPE) is a high clarity and chemically inert polymer that is frequently utilized. It is one among the more affordable polymers that are accessible. Molecular weight distribution (MWD), long-chain branching distribution (LCBD), and short-chain branching distribution are three factors that determine the processing and end-use qualities of LDPE (SCBD). Continue reading to learn more about its attributes and applications.

USES AND APPLICATIONS

  • It is a homopolymer; made of a single monomer, ethylene
  • The polymer density is controlled by the kind of branching it has
  • LDPE contains a mix of long branched chains and short branched chains
  • LDPE is characterized by 50-65% crystallinity, as the packing of the molecules is not the tightest
  • It is translucent in appearance, as a result of the crystallinity
  • LDPE is sufficiently malleable and elastic, able to undergo significant elongation before breakage
  • LDPE is susceptible to stress-cracking beyond a point
  • It has a sufficient moisture barrier
  • Used during the second world war in the high-frequency radar cables
  • Comes in various levels of flexibility depending on the production process
  • It does have lower density, hardness, stiffness, or strength compared to HDPE

products.title: LLDPE
products.description:
Linear low-density polyethylene (LLDPE) is a polymer (polyethylene) that is largely linear and has a significant number of short branches. It is often produced by copolymerizing ethylene with longer-chain olefins. Because of its flexibility and durability, linear low-density polyethylene (LLDPE) is utilized in packaging and films. Compared to low-density polyethylene (LDPE), HDPE is often transparent and less flexible. It is stronger, stiffer, and more chemically resistant than LDPE thanks to its increased crystallinity.

USES AND APPLICATIONS

  • LLDPE has higher tensile strength and higher impact and puncture resistance than does LDPE
  • Very flexible and elongates under stress.
  • Used to make thinner films, with better environmental stress cracking resistance
  • Has good resistance to chemicals
  • Has good electrical properties
  • Has lower gloss, and narrower range for heat sealing
  • Used to make stretchable Pouches. Stretch wrap, Cable jacketing
  • Used to make Flexible tubing, Geomembranes, Sheeting

  • Opaque or transparent

  • Short or long glass fibers, natural fibers or even self-reinforced
  • Super resistance to tears & puncture
  • Greater transparency and better heat resistance at high temperatures.

products.title: VAM

products.title: ABS RESIN

products.title: EPS - Expandable Polystyrene
products.description:
Expanded Polystyrene (EPS) is a hard, closed-cell thermoplastic foam material made from solid polystyrene beads that include a dissolved expansion gas (pentane) that were polymerized from styrene monomer. Small amounts of gas are included in each solid polystyrene bead, and when heat (in the form of steam) is introduced, the gas expands to form closed cells of EPS. Large EPS blocks can be molded into precise, unique shapes using a second heat treatment and a mold since the expanded cells occupy about 40 times the volume of the initial polystyrene bead.

USES AND APPLICATIONS

  • Eps can be molded in a range of densities
  • Has compressive strength
  • Typically water resistant
  • Very high impact resistant and tough
  • Has long term stable thermal conductivity
  • Is non-toxic and chemically inert. 
  • Impact resistance and shock absorbency for the protection of products
  • Protecting all kinds of electrical components, from mobile phones to fridge-freezers
  • Protect food and avoid damage during various stages of food production
  • Low thermal conductivity is utilized largely in the fish industry

products.title: ALCOHOL
products.description:
Among organic substances, alcohols are quite prevalent. They are some of the most widely produced organic molecules in industry, utilized as sweeteners and in the creation of perfumes, useful synthesis intermediates for other compounds. Ethanol and methanol are a couple of the most well-known alcohols (or methyl alcohol). Hospital equipment is sterilized with ethanol, which is also used in cosmetics, medications, and gasoline. Furthermore, it is the alcohol in alcoholic drinks. Alcohol is also used to create the anesthetic ether. In addition to being used as a solvent, methanol is also utilized as a raw ingredient to make formaldehyde and specific resins, as well as in antifreeze, special fuels, and the cleaning of metals.

USES AND APPLICATIONS

  • Most alcohols are colorless liquids or solids at room temperature
  • Alcohols of low molecular weight are highly soluble in water
  • With increasing molecular weight, they become less soluble in water
  • The boiling points of alcohols are much higher than those of alkanes with similar molecular weights.
  • Methanol (methyl alcohol) was originally produced by heating wood chips in the absence of air.
  • Used as a reagent in making polyesters, explosives, alkyd resins, and synthetic waxes.
  • Hydroboration-oxidation is also useful for adding water across the double bond of an alkene

products.title: ACRYLATE
products.description:
Acrylates are the derivatives of acrylic acid, including its esters, salts, and conjugate bases. They are created from acrylate monomer, which typically consists of esters that contain vinyl groups, which are two carbon atoms that are directly connected to the carbonyl carbon of the ester group and are double bonded to one another. Acrylates have a wide range of distinctive characteristics, including super absorbency, transparency, flexibility, toughness, and hardness. These materials are utilized in a variety of applications, including contact lenses and bone cement as well as diapers, cosmetics, orthopedics, paints and coatings, adhesives, and textiles.

USES AND APPLICATIONS

  • Acrylic in apparel includes sweaters, shocks, blankets, and fleece or high-pile fabrics.
  • Acrylic is also used to create fur substitutes
  • Super-absorbency, transparency, flexibility, toughness
  • These kinds of materials are used in diapers, cosmetics, and coatings
  • Acrylic in furnishings include upholstery fabrics and carpet
  • Acrylic resists the sun, draperies and outdoor
  • Other things: sportswear, socks, shoe liners, and industrial filter

products.title: BPA
products.description:
An industrial chemical called bisphenol-A (BPA) is utilized in the production of plastics and is added to a variety of consumer goods, such as food containers, infant bottles, plastic water bottles, and personal hygiene items. Since the 1960s, it has been utilized to create durable plastics for use in household kitchens and food packaging. It's important to note that many BPA-free goods use bisphenol-S (BPS) or bisphenol-F (BPF) in place of BPA. These substances are similar to BPA in structure and function, but their safety has not yet been thoroughly investigated.

USES AND APPLICATIONS

  • Contained in Canned foods, Toiletries, Menstrual products
  • Thermal printer receipts, CDs and DVDs, Household electronics
  • Eyeglass lenses, Sports equipment, Dental filling sealants
  • Avoid using polycarbonate plastic baby bottles; use glass bottles instead
  • Do not put boiling or very hot formula or other liquids in plastic bottles
  • Do not warm plastic baby bottles in a microwave
  • Avoid liquid or powdered formula packaged in metal cans
  • Try to use powdered formula packaged in cardboard without epoxy liners

products.title: SAN - Styrene Acrylonitrile copolymer
products.description:
A transparent and heat-resistant thermoplastic copolymer known as Poly(styrene-co-acrylonitrile) (SAN) is created when styrene and acrylonitrile are subjected to free radical polymerization. Styrene normally makes up 60 to 80 percent of the relative composition, and 20 to 40 percent of the composition is acrylonitrile. SAN is a material that is transparent and resistant to oils, fats, and cleaning agents, making it ideal for use in the kitchen as mixing bowls, basins, and refrigerator fittings. Additionally, it is used for dinnerware, cutlery, coffee filters, jars and beakers, as well as storage containers for a variety of goods, as well as the outer shells of thermally insulated jugs. Multi-trip tableware for the catering industry is another application.

USES AND APPLICATIONS

  • Used in printers, calculators, instruments and lamps
  • Chemical and solvent resistance
  • Better heat stability
  • Higher heat-deflection temperature
  • Very durable at relative low cost
  • Transparent kitchenware and houseware articles
  • Important applications include scales, battery housings, and winding cores

products.title: SAP - Super Absorbent Polymer
products.description:
The majority come in granular or fiber form and are manufactured of sodium polyacrylate. The granular substance is a polymer consisting of millions of identical sodium acrylate units arranged into a structure resembling a chain-fence. Depending on the kind and strength of cross-linkers utilized to create the gel, the SAP's total absorbency and swelling capacity can be altered. Low-density cross-linked SAPs often have a greater capacity for absorption and swell to a greater extent. Additionally, the gel formation in these SAPs is softer and stickier. Low absorbent capacity and swelling are characteristics of high cross-link density polymers, whereas the gel strength is stiffer and can hold its shape even under light pressure.

USES AND APPLICATIONS

  • Keep the skin dry
  • Protect against skin irritation
  • Prevent the spread of infections
  • Offer improved quality of life and personal dignity
  • Enhance and improve soil properties
  • Medical
  • Agriculture & horticulture
  • Hygiene products
  • Food & transportation

products.title: NBR - Nitrile Butadiene Rubber
products.description:
NBR (Nitrile Butadiene Rubber) is a synthetic rubber mostly composed of butadiene, with acrylonitrile playing a significant role. In the modern seal industry, it is the elastomer that is most frequently utilized. It is best to use this type of rubber, commonly known as nitrile, when creating products that will come into touch with fuels and mineral oils. NBR can tolerate grease extremely well. Since standard rubbers cannot be used, it is used to create fuel and oil handling hoses, seals, grommets, and self-sealing fuel tanks in the automotive and aerospace industries.

USES AND APPLICATIONS

  • Aircraft Fuel Systems
  • Automotive Fuel Systems
  • Off-Road Equipment
  • Marine Fuel Systems
  • Not altered by minor structural/compositional differences
  • Applications are in fuel hoses
  • The lower the ACN content, the lower the glass transition temperature
  • NBR is also employed in textiles

products.title: SB LATEX - Styrene Butadiene Latex
products.description:
In many commercial and industrial applications, styrene-butadiene (SB) latex is a typical kind of emulsion polymer. SB latex is a copolymer because it contains styrene and butadiene, two different kinds of monomers. Filler acceptance and a balanced tensile/elongation ratio are two advantages of styrene-butadiene latex. High water resistance and adherence to difficult surfaces are made possible by the flexibility of this copolymer, which enables a nearly endless variety of mixes. Because of these characteristics, SB latex is a necessary synthetic in a growing number of markets.

USES AND APPLICATIONS

  • Filler acceptance
  • Tensile/elongation balance
  • Synthetic essential to an ever-widening group of markets
  • Used as a coating in paper products
  • Achieve high gloss, good printability
  • Resistance to oil and water
  • Key component in liquid-applied membranes, and construction adhesives
  • Key component in low MVTR barrier coatings for food packaging

products.description:
Solution-polymerized styrene-butadiene rubber (SSBR) is produced by polymerizing butadiene-1,3 and styrene in a hydrocarbon solvent with a lithium-organic catalyst. Solution SBRs are the top choice for the development of tire compounds, notably for summer and winter tire treads and low rolling resistance tires, particularly in the high-performance market. SSBR is widely utilized in the tire, industrial rubber, cable, and footwear sectors.

USES AND APPLICATIONS

  • Rapid industrialization
  • Rising automobile production
  • Modernization of industrial machinery
  • Further boost the growth of the market
  • Increasing demand for SSBR in footwear
  • Rising use in sportswear
  • Use in Automotive Tires, Polymer Modification, Footwear, and Adhesives
  • Synthetic Rubbers

products.title: IPA - Isopropyl Alcohol
products.description:
As a rubbing-alcohol antibacterial, isopropyl alcohol is combined with water. In the ultraviolet-visible spectrum, isopropyl alcohol has the highest absorption at 205 nm. It is used in industry as a low-cost solvent for cosmetics, pharmaceuticals, shellacs, and gums, as well as to denaturize ethanol (ethyl alcohol). Isopropyl alcohol is miscible in water, ethanol, and chloroform because it is a polar molecule like these. It dissolves ethyl cellulose, polyvinyl butyral, as well as a wide range of oils, alkaloids, and natural resins. Isopropyl alcohol, unlike ethanol or methanol, is not miscible with salt solutions and can be isolated from aqueous solutions.

USES AND APPLICATIONS

  • Extremely flammable
  • Colorless and has an intense but pleasant odor
  • Oxidize in contact with the environment, turning into Acetone
  • As an indicator of reactions and a solvent for chemical reagents
  • In medicine to disinfect surfaces
  • In the cosmetics and household product industries
  • A major ingredient in "gas dryer" fuel additives

products.title: PIA - Purified Isophthalic Acid
products.description:
Isophthalic acid (PIA), a white solid, is an isomer of phthalic acid and terephthalic acid. These aromatic dicarboxylic acids are employed as precursors (in the form of acylchlorides) to economically relevant polymers. Polybenzimidazole, a high-performance polymer, is made from isophthalic acid. Isophthalic acid is generally utilized as an intermediary in unsaturated polyester resins and alkyd and polyester coating resins; however, it is also employed in aramid fibers, as a component of copolyester resins, and in high-temperature polymers.

USES AND APPLICATIONS

  • Reduces the crystallinity of PET
  • Improve clarity and increase the productivity of bottle-making
  • Improves thermal resistance and mechanical performance
  • Enhances hydrolytic stability
  • Decreases dry times for high solids and traditional solvent-borne coatings
  • Reduces cycle time and lowers energy requirements
  • Improves taste in bottled water without the unpleasant flavor of acetaldehyde
  • Reduces permeability to carbon dioxide and oxygen

products.title: ACETONE
products.description:
Acetone, commonly known as propanone, is a colorless liquid. In certain concentrations, it is generally recognized as safe (GRAS), with low toxicity but considerable flammability. Although this chemical is commonly found in several household and cosmetic items, it is also found in commercial settings, where it is typically utilized as a thinner for lacquers or in the manufacture of plastics. In most cases, drinking a little amount of acetone will not affect a healthy individual. But certain amounts could be harmful to a youngster, and adults who consume a considerable amount of acetone may suffer from acetone poisoning.

USES AND APPLICATIONS

  • Nail polish removers
  • Used in the textile industry for degreasing wool
  • Used in the textile industry for degumming silk
  • Incorporated in solvent systems or blends
  • Used to make lacquers for automotive and furniture finishes
  • Used to reduce the viscosity, or thickness, of lacquer solutions
  • Making plastics

products.title: METHYLENE CHLORIDE
products.description:
Methylene chloride (CH2Cl2) exposure may cause injury to workers. The degree of exposure is determined by the dose, duration, and type of work performed. If you utilize methylene chloride-containing items, you may be exposed via inhaling the chemical's vapors. This substance could potentially be absorbed through the skin. Methylene chloride (CH2Cl2) is a colorless liquid that has the potential to injure the eyes, skin, liver, and heart. Drowsiness, dizziness, numbness and tingling in the extremities, and nausea might result with exposure. It has been linked to cancer. Severe exposure can result in unconsciousness and death.

USES AND APPLICATIONS

  • Bathtub refinishers exposed to glazing fumes
  • Workers who use paint stripping products
  • Factories workers involved in metal cleaning and degreasing
  • Employees who work in pharmaceutical manufacturing
  • Used as a solvent for paint stripper, varnish removal
  • Also used as a solvent for aerosol spray repellent and degreasing
  • Highly volatility and stability

products.title: TETRAHYDROFURAN
products.description:
Tetrahydrofuran (THF) is a colorless, transparent chemical molecule having an ether-like odor. It is commonly used to dissolve and react diverse compounds. It is also utilized as a starting material in the production of poly glycol, among other things. Tetrahydrofuran is used as a solvent in a variety of industries, including natural and synthetic resins, high polymers, fat oils, rubber, polymer and protective coating, adhesives, inks, tetramethyl lead, PVC, and the manufacture of nylon and adipic acid. It is also utilized as a reaction medium in processes such as Grignard syntheses and lithium aluminum hydride reductions, particularly in the pharmaceutical industry.

USES AND APPLICATIONS

  • Used as a solvent for synthetic leather coatings
  • Used as a solvent for vinyl and epoxy adhesives
  • Used for vinyl chloride heat-shrinkable film and for desiccant
  • Suitable for printing inks
  • Used as a solvent for special resins
  • Used as a solvent for Grignard and Wittig reactions
  • Used in pharmaceutical and agricultural manufacturing
  • Used as a solvent for reaction and purification

products.title: CYCLOHEXANONE
products.description:
Cyclohexanone (also known as oxocyclohexane, pimelic ketone, cyclohexyl ketone, and CYC) is a colorless to light yellow liquid with a pungent odor. It is a six-carbon cyclic molecule with the formula C6H10O that belongs to the class of cyclic ketones (organic compounds). It is just slightly soluble in water, is totally miscible with ordinary solvents, and reacts with oxidants like nitric acid. It is found naturally in crude oils and is also synthesized in vast amounts as a critical step in the manufacturing of nylon.

USES AND APPLICATIONS

  • Adhesives
  • Automotive
  • Cleaning and furniture care products
  • Electronics
  • Paints
  • Photo chemicals
  • Polyesters and synthetic resins
  • Cellulose acetate
  • Crude rubber
  • Degreasers
  • Lacquers
  • Paints
  • Polymers and copolymers
  • Resins

products.title: BUTYL ACETATE
products.description:
Butyl acetate has the chemical formula C6H12O2 and is an ester that is transparent and colorless. It has distinctive flavors and a sweet banana aroma and is present in many fruits, red apples in particular. This organic substance is used in a number of products, such as food flavoring, lacquer manufacture solvent, polishes, inks, adhesives, and occasionally high-boiling solvents. With its main end-user markets being the paints/lacquers, coatings, cosmetics, leather, cleaning, and pharmaceutical industries, butyl acetate has a wide range of industrial and consumer uses.

  • Adhesives/sealants-B&C
  • Aerosol, Aerospace, Architectural coatings, Coil coatings
  • Auto OEM, plastics, refinish
  • Automotive parts & accessories, protective coatings
  • Commercial printing inks

products.title: ETHYL ACETATE
products.description:
The acetate ester produced when acetic acid and ethanol react is known as ethyl acetate. It functions as an EC 3.4.19.3 (pyroglutamyl-peptidase I) inhibitor, a metabolite, and a Saccharomyces cerevisiae metabolite in addition to being a polar aprotic solvent. It is a volatile organic chemical, an ethyl ester, and an acetate ester. In the industrial and commercial sectors, ethyl acetate is widely used as a diluent and a solvent. Tea leaves and coffee beans are both decaffeinated with it.

USES AND APPLICATIONS

  • Used as an indirect food additive in certain packaging materials
  • Widely used in the inks, pharmaceuticals and fragrance sectors
  • Used as flavoring agents and preservatives in the food industry
  • A good solvent for nitrocellulose, fats, varnishes, lacquers inks and aero plane dopes
  • Used in the production of smokeless powder, artificial leather
  • Used in photographic films and plates and artificial silk
  • Used as a cleaning agent in the textile industry

products.title: Toluene Diisocyanate
products.description:
Toluene diisocyanate (TDI) is a chemical that is used in the manufacturing of polyurethanes, primarily for flexible foam applications such as bedding and furniture, carpet underlay, and packaging. products.title: POLYESTER POLYOL
products.description:
Polyester polyols are commonly produced from diol, triol, and dibasic acid or anhydride combinations. The resulting polymer is hydroxy-terminated due to a stoichiometric excess of hydroxyl over carboxylic acid functionality. Polyester polyols are widely used in a variety of applications, including stiff and flexible foams, surface and fabric coatings, microcellular shoe systems, moisture cured PU, industrial coatings, inks, and castable elastomers. Polyester polyols in polyurethanes are also extremely resistant to oil, grease, gasoline, and nonpolar solvents.

USES AND APPLICATIONS

  • Higher physical properties, cut, tear and wear resistance,
  • Better sliding abrasion and flex fatigue resistance.
  • They are tough and durable.
  • Exhibit very good resistance to oil, grease, fuels and nonpolar solvents
  • Better suited for high-temperature application.
  • Show good adhesion to commonly used substrates.
  • Vibration dampening and shock absorption properties
  • Safe to use in food contact applications
  • Wheels, industrial and printing rolls
  • Pipeline pigs
  • Adhesives
  • Footwear and shoe soles
  • Industrial applications requiring good thermal stability.
  • Food contact (FDA compliant)
  • TPUs for automotive and cable jacketing

products.title: Caustic Soda
products.description:
Caustic soda is an alkaline salt commonly known as Lye. It is also known as sodium hydroxide. This salt is given this name due to its corrosive effect on animal and plant tissues. It has many different applications. NaOH is the chemical formula for sodium hydroxide. Caustic Soda or Sodium Hydroxide has numerous applications, including unclogging drains and producing soap. The primary use of caustic soda is as a drain pipe cleaner, a drain unclogged, a grease remover, and an ingredient in soaps and detergents. It is a multipurpose item to have around the house due to its various applications.

USES AND APPLICATIONS

  • It is a white solid which has a melting point of 591K
  • It is a stable compound
  • NaOH is bitter and has a soapy feel to it
  • It is highly soluble in water and moderately soluble in alcohol
  • Sodium hydroxide is strongly alkaline in nature
  • It is used as a cleansing agent and in the manufacturing of washing soda
  • Sometimes, sodium hydroxide is also used as a reagent in the laboratories
  • It is used in the preparation of soda lime
  • It is used in the extraction of aluminum by purifying bauxite

products.title: Liquid Chlorine
products.description:
Liquefied chlorine gas is created by the electrolysis of a salt solution. Due to its strong oxidizing activity, it is used as a raw material for oxidizing agents, bleaches, disinfectants, and different chlorides. Due to its severe toxicity, it must be handled with utmost caution and in line with local regulations. The pH must be brought back to normal levels to make it useful for normal purposes. Liquid chlorine is highly corrosive and, if not handled with care, can cause damage to your pool or its equipment.

USES AND APPLICATIONS of LIQUID CHLORINE

  • Generally, 60-80% less costly than the granular version
  • Most popular option
  • Comes in refillable containers, whereas granular shock is a one-time use
  • Does not need to dissolve in water since it is already a liquid
  • Non-scaling and leaves no residue
  • Is more commonly used
  • Is often much cheaper
  • Is refillable
  • Mixes easily with water
  • Does not leave any buildup behind

products.title: Calcium Carbonate (CaCO3)
products.description:
Calcium carbonate, or CaCO3, contains more than four percent of the earth's crust and is widespread. Its most prevalent natural forms are chalk, limestone, and marble, which were formed over millions of years by the sedimentation of the shells of minuscule fossilized snails, shellfish, and coral. Although all three forms are chemically equivalent, they differ in purity, whiteness, thickness, and uniformity, among other characteristics. Calcium carbonate is among the most versatile and valuable substances known to man.

USES AND APPLICATIONS

  • It is a fluffy powder
  • It decomposes to give carbon dioxide when heated up to 1200K.
  • Liberates carbon dioxide as a by-product.
  • Largely employed in the pulp and paper industry.
  • Used as a filter and pigment
  • Another application of calcium carbonate is in fertilizers
  • Provide calcium to plants and pH stabilization of the soil
  • An additive to food products for livestock animals and humans
  • As a supplement in vitamins
  • Used as the removal of acidity and impurities
  • An important role in construction
  • Used in medicinal industries which manufacture antacids, tablets
  • Used as calcium supplement
  • Used in the manufacture of paints, paper, plastics, etc.

products.title: Calcium Chloride
products.description:
Calcium Chloride is a calcium and chlorine ionic combination. At room temperature, the color is pure white in crystalline form. It is hygroscopic because it is very soluble in water. It has a very high enthalpy change of solution and is odorless. This substance is commonly used for dust control and de-icing. It is a solid salt at normal temperature and behaves like an ordinary ionic halide. It is used in a variety of applications, including brine for refrigeration facilities, ice and dust control on roadways, and cement.

USES AND APPLICATIONS

  • Used to prevent ice formation
  • Used in the production of activated charcoal
  • Used as a sterilant for male animals
  • Used in heating pads and self-heating cans
  • Used to correct the mineral deficiencies in brewing beer
  • Calcium chloride is used as an electrolyte in sports drinks

products.title: Plasticizers
products.description:
A plasticizer is a low-volatility liquid or solid chemical added to a raw polymer, such as a plastic or rubber, to increase its flexibility, make it simpler to shape and mold, and minimize surface friction. When added to a polymer, they incorporate themselves into the polymer chains, acting as a buffer between the molecule segments. Consider how the cartilage in your knee cushions the joints and aids in bending and movement. Without plasticizers, the material would be brittle, inflexible, and difficult to shape.

USES AND APPLICATIONS

  • Cost reduction
  • Viscosity reduction
  • Solvency enhancement
  • Surface lubricity augmentation
  • Low temperature property improvement
  • Plasticizer can be easily mixed with resin
  • Plasticizer penetrates and swells the resin particles
  • Polar groups in the PVC resin are freed from each other
  • Plasticizer polar groups interact with the polar groups on the PVC chain
  • PVC structure is re-established Upon cooling

products.title: Phthalic Anhydride (PA)
products.description:
Phthalic anhydride is a needle-shaped, colorless to white, glossy solid with a slight, unique odor. It is somewhat poisonous by inhalation or ingestion and an irritant to the skin. Utilized in the production of materials such as synthetic resins. White, crystalline phthalic anhydride is used in the production of phthalein and other colors, resins, plasticizers, and pesticides. The anhydride of phthalic acid is phthalic anhydride. This colorless solid is an essential industrial chemical, particularly for the mass manufacture of plasticizers. Currently, it is produced using the catalytic oxidation of ortho–xylene or naphthalene. Additionally, phthalic anhydride can be produced from phthalic acid.

USES AND APPLICATIONS

  • Used in paints and lacquers, insect repellents, and urethane polyester polyols
  • As a chemical intermediate in the production of plasticizers from polyvinyl chloride
  • Production of alkyd resins
  • Production of polyester resins
  • Plasticizers are derived from phthalic anhydride
  • Principal markets are construction, marine and transportation
  • Usually blended with glass fibers to produce fiberglass-reinforced plastics
  • Used as a rubber scorch inhibitor and retarder

products.title: Maleic Anhydride (MA)
products.description:
Maleic anhydride is utilized in resin formation. Maleic anhydride exposure can arise through inadvertent environmental discharges or at workplaces where it is produced or used. Acute (short-term) inhalation of maleic anhydride has been observed to induce irritation of the respiratory tract and the eyes in people. It has been reported that chronic (long-term) exposure to maleic anhydride causes chronic bronchitis, asthma-like episodes, and irritation of the upper respiratory tract and eyes in workers. Some individuals have developed allergies to the point that they can no longer tolerate lesser dosages. Rats continuously gavage-exposed to maleic anhydride exhibited kidney dysfunction (experimentally placing the chemical in the stomach).

USES AND APPLICATIONS

  • Synthetic resin raw material
  • Paints and coatings
  • Resin modifiers
  • Vinyl chloride stabilizers
  • Food additives
  • Agricultural chemicals

  • Surfactants
  • Plasticizers (DOM, DBM, DEM)
  • Other (GBL, 14BG, THF)
  • Colorless or white crystalline solid
  • Acrid (irritating, choking, and offensive) odor
  • Readily soluble in water
  • Molecular weight is 98.06 g/mol
  • Vapor specific gravity is 3.4
  • Can be harmful if swallowed

products.title: Formic Acid

Systematically, formic acid is referred to as methanolic acid. The common names for carboxylic acids are derived from the Latin or Greek names of their sources. products.title: Polyvinyl Alcohol
products.description:
Polyvinyl Alcohol (PVA) is a synthetic resin that is used to treat fabrics and paper; it is colorless and dissolves in water. Sizing agents containing PVA are used to increase the durability of textile yarns and to improve the paper's resistance to oils and greases. It is used as a building block in the production of other resins and as a component in adhesives and emulsifiers. It is also used as a water-soluble protective film. The Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has determined that PVA is safe for use in food packaging; PVA is also recognized as a GRAS ingredient by the FDA; and PVA is used in the biomedical and pharmaceutical industries.

USES AND APPLICATIONS

  • Used in a variety of medical applications because of its biocompatibility, low tendency for protein adhesion, and low toxicity
  • Specific uses include cartilage replacements, contact lenses, and eye drops
  • Polyvinyl alcohol is used as an aid in suspension polymerizations
  • Its largest application in China is its use as a protective colloid to make PVAc dispersions
  • In Japan its major use is the production of Vinylon fiber
  • Used widely in additive manufacturing
  • commonly used in household sponges that absorb more water than Polyurethane sponges
  • PVA glue is commonly used for gluing porous materials like wood, paper and cloth

products.title: Glacial Acetic Acid
products.description:
Acetic acid containing less than 1% water is referred to as anhydrous (water-free) acetic acid or glacial acetic acid. It is termed glacial because it freezes into ice-like acetic acid crystals at 16.7 degrees Celsius, just below room temperature. An organic acid responsible for vinegar's sour flavor and pungent aroma. A weak acid in the sense that its aqueous solution is only partially dissociated. It is a crucial chemical reagent and industrial chemical that is used in the synthesis of polyethylene terephthalate, which is mostly utilized in soft drinks.  

USES AND APPLICATIONS

  • Clinical laboratories use glacial acetic acid to test blood
  • Synthetic fibers, such as cellulose acetate and rayon, are made possible with glacial acetic acid
  • Personal care products, including perfumes, acetone, and esters, are manufactured with acetic acid
  • Industrial uses of glacial acetic acid include its use as a solvent in photographic film
  • In the preparation of dyes and inks, in transforming rubber from latex, in the fabrication of polyvinyl acetate for wood glue
  • Manufactures substrates, pesticides, white lead, and soft drinking bottles
  • Schools, colleges, and universities rely on glacial acetic acid as a chemical reagent
  • Absorbs water from its environment, and to prove its acidic properties by transforming blue litmus paper into red
  • When mixed with sodium bicarbonate, the reaction causes a sensational amount of carbon dioxide and salt

products.title: Melamine
products.description:

Melamine resin is sturdy, fire and heat-resistant, and almost indestructible, which makes melamine items more desired than those made from other plastics. Since melamine-ware is not readily broken, it is frequently used as children's tableware.

products.title: Sodium Hydrosulfite
products.description:
Sodium Hydrosulfite serves as a crucial chemical in textile industries worldwide. Its primary function lies in its ability to act as a potent reducing agent, facilitating indigo dyeing and providing a non-aggressive alternative to bleach for color removal from dyed fabrics and whitening antique textiles. This versatile compound is valued for its mild yet effective action, preserving the integrity of delicate fibers while achieving desired color outcomes. Beyond textiles, sodium hydrosulfite finds applications in different industrial sectors.

Uses and Applications of Sodium Hydrosulfite

  • Indigo dyeing in textile manufacturing
  • Bleaching agent for paper pulp
  • Color removal from dyed fabrics
  • Textile cleaning and restoration
  • Chemical cleaning in industrial processes
  • Water treatment applications
  • Preservation of historical textiles
  • Food processing as a reducing agent
  • Environmental applications for pollutant removal

products.title: PET SHEETS
products.description:
PET sheet (polyethylene terephthalate) is a typical thermoplastic with superior dimensional stability, mechanical strength, and creep resistance. It has chemical resistance, very low moisture absorption, and is an excellent electrical insulator. PET sheet also performs well in wear applications and has a robust, rigid, easily machined and polished surface. Bearings, pump parts, frame components, tank lids, insulators, friction strips, and control discs are typical products of this material. Primarily employed in mechanical, marine, electrical, and food and pharmaceutical applications.

USES AND APPLICATIONS

  • Very high dimensional stability
  • Excellent creep behavior
  • High mechanical strength, hardness and toughness
  • Very low moisture absorption
  • Good electric insulation properties
  • Excellent resistance to chemicals
  • Sensitive to hydrolysis
  • Highly machinable
  • Natural PET sheet is food approved

products.title: PVC SHEETS

This sheet is typically utilized for self-supporting tanks, fabricated components, tank linings, and spacers.

products.title: Co-extruded Multilayered Films and Sheets for Food Packaging
products.description:
Coextruded multilayer film is made using a compound molding technology that concurrently extrudes thermoplastic resin with several extruders and passes it through a single die to form layers of molten resin on both the interior and exterior of a film. They are multifunctional multilayer films and sheets designed to exhibit characteristics of each component film and stacked using specialized techniques to achieve the desired thickness. Multiple functions, including as heat resistance, heat sealing capabilities, rigidity, flexibility, cold resistance, and easy-peel capabilities, can therefore be combined in a single film.

products.title: ARTIFICIAL LEATHER
products.description:
Artificial leather, sometimes known as synthetic leather, is a material designed to replace leather in furniture, apparel, footwear, and other applications where a leather-like appearance is sought but the actual material is too expensive or unsuitable. This artificial leather is a vinyl-coated cloth with a velvety texture that resembles genuine leather. Similarly, vegan leather is a sort of synthetic leather composed of several materials such as Birikibuc, Kydex, Lorica, PVC, etc. It is used to manufacture apparel, footwear, and accessories. Barkcloth is woven from sheets of tree bark that have been shaped and flattened.

USES AND APPLICATIONS

  • Often used in clothing fabrics, furniture upholstery, water craft upholstery, and automotive interiors.
  • May be porous and breathable, or may be impermeable and waterproof
  • A popular choice for clothing, and is comfortable to wear
  • Requires little maintenance in comparison to leather
  • Does not crack or fade easily
  • Polyurethane – a type of artificial leather is currently more popular for use than PVC
  • Artificial leather will cost very less compared to genuine leather

products.title: LDPE / LLDPE / HDPE FILMS
products.description:
LDPE (Low-Density Polyethylene), LLDPE (Linear Low-Density Polyethylene), and HDPE (High-Density Polyethylene) films and sheets are essential materials in the plastics industry. LDPE is known for its flexibility and transparency, making it ideal for packaging and covering applications. LLDPE offers enhanced tensile strength and puncture resistance, providing durability for heavy-duty uses. HDPE, with its higher density, is characterized by its rigidity and resistance to impact and chemicals. These films and sheets are produced through extrusion, resulting in materials tailored to specific thicknesses and strengths. products.title: Laminated Films
products.description:
Laminated films are constructed by bonding multiple layers of films together, generally involving materials like polyethylene, polyester, or polypropylene. This lamination process combines the strengths of each layer, resulting in a film that has improved mechanical properties, such as enhanced tear resistance, moisture barrier capabilities, and overall durability. Laminated films are vastly used in different industries, including food packaging, pharmaceuticals, and consumer goods, offering a solid solution that ensures product integrity and extends shelf life. Their adaptability allows them to be customized to specific requirements, making them a preferred choice for many applications.

Uses and Applications of Laminated Films

  1. Used in food packaging
  2. Employed in pharmaceutical packaging
  3. Used in the packaging of consumer goods
  4. Utilized in agricultural products packaging
  5. Applied in the electronics industry
  6. Used in the creation of flexible packaging solutions (pouches & bags)
  7. Serve as barrier films in medical packaging
  8. Used in the automotive industry
  9. Employed in the construction industry
  10. Used in stationery products (book covers & laminating pouches)

products.description:

  2. Recycling facilities for recovering copper and other valuable metals

products.title: Used Railways
products.description:
Used Railways refer to salvaged sections of rail tracks sourced from railway systems. These tracks are categorized based on their weight per piece, following the guidelines set by the Institute of Scrap Recycling Industries (ISRI). The two main categories are R50 and R65, with R50 consisting of rails weighing at least 50 kilograms per piece, and R65 consisting of rails weighing at least 65 kilograms per piece. To qualify as railway scrap, these tracks must be undamaged, free from connections and impurities. They are commonly cut into lengths ranging from 1.5 to 2.2 meters to facilitate transportation and handling. An average loading in a 20-foot dry container is approximately 27.5 metric tons.

Uses and Applications

  1. Railroad track construction
  2. Steel manufacturing
  3. Industrial machinery
  4. Infrastructure development
  5. Scrap metal recycling
  6. Fabrication of structural components
  7. Railroad maintenance and repair
  8. Construction of bridges and tunnels
  9. Production of steel beams and bars
  10. Manufacturing of heavy equipment

products.title: ISRI 208 ( No.1 Bundles )
products.description:
ISRI 208 (No.1 Bundles) refers to new black steel sheet scrap, commonly in the form of clippings or skeleton scrap. These scraps are compressed or hand bundled to charging box size, ensuring ease of handling and transportation. Each bundle weighs not less than 75 pounds per cubic foot and is tightly secured manually or with a magnet for safe handling. The material may include Stanley balls or mandrel wound bundles, which are tightly secured and may contain chemically detinned material. However, it excludes old auto body or Fender stock. products.title: ISRI 216 (Terne Plate Bundles)
products.description:
ISRI 216, Terne Plate Bundles, are a type of scrap material composed of terne plate sheet clippings or skeleton scrap. Terne plate is a type of steel coated with an alloy of lead and tin, providing corrosion resistance and durability. It is commonly used in roofing, automotive, and construction industries.
